page.title: 06Employment in Insch contd..
page.content: Giving service to the community in a more general way are building firms such as Mansell Watson,employing fifteen people,and George Moir,with three men.A firm employing six in joinery work is Bremner and Stephen. The Royal Bank,the Clydesdale and the T.S.B.employ fourteen people between them and they find the local farmers to be excellent customers, often requiring loans to buy new machinery, stock or seeds. Grampian Regional Council employ sixteen nurses and three doctors, plus a few ancillary staff,at the hospital. Insch School presently has ten teachers,a headmaster,a janitor and a number of part_time catering and cleaning staff. Among the larger shops giving work to locals is Souters Ltd., which opened in 1905, and employs nine people.
